articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Fighting in the city of Rafah, where Israel is targeting the remaining brigades of the militant Islamist Hamas movement, would continue, the military said.
articles.title: Israeli military announces tactical pauses in Gaza for aid supplies

articles.author: Thomas Escritt, Sabine Siebold
articles.description: Western powers and countries from the rest of the world will use the second day of a major summit in Switzerland on Sunday to pursue a consensus on condemning Russia's invasion of Ukraine and underscoring concerns about the war's human cost.
articles.title: Ukraine summit strives for broad consensus to lean on Russia to end war

articles.author: Sophie Yu, Casey Hall, Lisa Barrington
articles.description: A recovery in Chinese overseas travel from the COVID-19 pandemic is fading as rising costs and difficulties in securing visas cement a preference for local and short-haul destinations.
articles.title: Chinese outbound travel recovery lags due to costs, visa snags

articles.author: Francesco Guarascio, Khanh Vu
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin will visit Hanoi this week, multiple officials said, highlighting Communist-ruled Vietnam's loyalty to Russia and triggering a U.S. rebuke.
articles.title: Russia's Putin to visit Vietnam, sparking US rebuke of Hanoi

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan is not seeking war with Beijing, and its policy is to build up a defensive, multi-level deterrence capability to make it harder for China to capture the island, Taiwan Defence Minister Wellington Koo said on Monday.
articles.title: Taiwan is not seeking war with China, defence minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The world is way off track on most of the sustainable development targets agreed in 2015, such as tackling poverty and hunger, says a United Nations report which cites funding shortfalls, geopolitical tensions and the COVID-19 pandemic.
articles.title: World falling behind on environment, health and hunger goals, UN report says

articles.author: Artorn Pookasook, Juarawee Kittisilpa
articles.description: Thai lesbian couple Vorawan "Beaut" Ramwan and Anticha "An" Sangchai are patiently waiting for the passage of their country's same-sex marriage law so that they can cement their relationship after four years together.
articles.title: As Thailand moves to pass same-sex marriage law, couple wait to tie the knot

articles.author: Peter Hobson, Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Chinese Premier Li Qiang met on Monday in the first visit to the country by a Chinese premier in seven years, with trade ties, regional security and a jailed Australian writer on the host's agenda.
articles.title: Australia's Albanese, China's Li to discuss trade, jailed writer

articles.author: Hyun Yi
articles.description: The loudspeakers deployed by South Korea to wage psychological warfare against North Korea faced audits and legal battles claiming they are too quiet, raising questions over how far into the reclusive North their propaganda messages can blast.
articles.title: South Korea's loudspeakers face questions over reach into North

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Intensified cross-border fire from Lebanon's Hezbollah movement into Israel could trigger serious escalation, the Israeli military said on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel warns of escalation from cross-border fire from Hezbollah
